ingredients: 2 cloves garlic, peeled and left whole
method: Put a large saucepan of water on to boil.
Finely chop the pancetta, having first removed any rind.
Beat the eggs in a medium bowl, season with a little freshly grated black pepper, and set everything aside.
Add 1 tsp salt to the boiling water, add the spaghetti, and when the water comes back to the boil, cook at a constant simmer, covered, for 10 minutes or until al dente.
Squash the garlic with the blade of a knife, just to bruise it.
While the spaghetti is cooking, fry the pancetta with the garlic.

Drop the butter into a large frying pan or wok, add the pancetta and garlic, and cook on a medium heat for about 5 minutes, stirring often, until the pancetta is golden and crisp. The garlic is there to flavor the pancetta.

Keep the heat under the pancetta on low. When the pasta is ready, lift it from the water with a pasta fork or tongs and put it in the frying pan with the pancetta. Mix most of the cheese in with the eggs, keeping a small handful back for sprinkling over later.

Take the pan of spaghetti and pancetta off the heat. Quickly pour in the eggs and cheese. Using the tongs or a long fork, lift up the spaghetti so it mixes easily with the egg mixture, which thickens but doesn't scramble, and everything is coated.
Add extra pasta cooking water to keep it saucy. Season with a little salt, if needed.
Use a long-pronged fork to twist the pasta onto the serving plate or bowl. Serve immediately with a little sprinkling of the remaining cheese and a grating of black pepper.
Cut the chicken breasts into bite-sized pieces and set aside.
In a large pan, heat some oil and sauté the chopped onion until golden brown.
Add the minced garlic and grated ginger, and cook for another minute.
Add the turmeric, cumin, coriander, paprika, garam masala, and chili powder, and cook for a few more minutes, stirring constantly.
Add the tomato puree and cook for 10 minutes.
Add the chicken pieces to the pan, and cook until they are browned on all sides.
Pour in the coconut milk, reduce the heat, and let it simmer for about 20 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Garnish with fresh coriander before serving.

ingredients: 1 block firm tofu, drained and cubed
method: Heat the sesame oil in a large wok or frying pan over medium-high heat.
Add the cubed tofu and cook until golden brown on all sides. Remove and set aside.
In the same pan, add the garlic and cook for a minute until fragrant.
Add the red and yellow bell peppers, broccoli florets, and carrot. Stir-fry for about 5-7 minutes until vegetables are tender-crisp.
Add the tofu back into the pan.
Pour in the soy sauce and hoisin sauce, and mix well to coat all the ingredients.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Garnish with sesame seeds before serving.

ingredients: 500g beef sirloin, sliced into thin strips
method: In a large pan, heat olive oil over medium-high heat.
Add the beef strips and cook until browned. Remove and set aside.
In the same pan, sauté the onions until soft.
Add the garlic and mushrooms, and cook until the mushrooms are tender.
Sprinkle the flour over the vegetables and stir well.
Gradually add the beef broth, stirring constantly until the sauce thickens.
Stir in the sour cream and Dijon mustard, and season with salt and pepper.
Return the beef to the pan and simmer for a few more minutes.
Garnish with fresh parsley before serving.
In a large pan, heat olive oil over medium heat.
Sauté the onions and garlic until soft.
Add the bell peppers, zucchini, and green beans, and cook until tender.
Stir in the Arborio rice and cook for a few minutes.
Add the smoked paprika and saffron threads, and mix well.
Gradually add the vegetable broth, stirring constantly until the rice is cooked and the liquid is absorbed.
Stir in the peas and season with salt and pepper.
Garnish with lemon wedges before serving.
In a large pan, heat olive oil over medium-high heat.
Add the chicken strips and cook until browned.
Add the garlic, bell peppers, and onion, and cook until tender.
Stir in the chili powder, cumin, paprika, oregano, salt, and pepper.
Cook for a few more minutes until everything is well coated and cooked through.
Serve the chicken and vegetable mixture in warm tortillas.
Garnish with fresh cilantro before serving.
In a large bowl, combine the diced mangoes, red bell pepper, red onion, jalapeno, and cilantro.
Squeeze the lime juice over the mixture and season with salt and pepper.
Toss everything together until well combined.
Chill in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes before serving.
In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium heat.
Sauté the onions and garlic until soft.
Add the tomatoes and vegetable broth, and bring to a boil.
Reduce the heat and let it simmer for about 30 minutes.
Blend the soup until smooth using an immersion blender.
Stir in the fresh basil and season with salt and pepper.
Add the heavy cream and simmer for another 5 minutes.
Serve hot.
In a large bowl, combine the ground beef, chopped onion, garlic, salt, and pepper.
Form the mixture into 4 patties.
Heat a grill or frying pan over medium-high heat.
Cook the patties for about 4-5 minutes on each side, or until they reach your desired level of doneness.
Place a slice of cheddar cheese on each patty and cook until melted.
Toast the hamburger buns on the grill or in a pan.
Assemble the burgers with lettuce, tomato, pickles, ketchup, and mustard.
In a bowl, mash the avocados with lemon juice, salt, and pepper.
Toast the slices of whole grain bread until golden brown.
Spread the mashed avocado mixture evenly over the toasted bread slices.
Top with cherry tomatoes and radish slices.
Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with red pepper flakes, if desired.
